revised_title: The Cause of Vapour Ascent, Exhalation, and Winds: A New Hypothesis
tldr: The author, Henry Eeles, presents a hypothesis that the ascent of vapour and exhalation is caused by electrical fire, which keeps the lower part of the atmosphere more homogeneous and suitable for respiration and vision. He also discusses the cause of winds and the general phenomena of weather and the barometer. Eeles challenges some generally accepted opinions and proposes a new way of understanding these atmospheric processes.
